question: Who among the following Parmara ruler was the founder of the Bhojshala (a college) near Dhar?
explanation:
Bhoja (also known as Raja Bhoj of Dhar) was the founder of the Bhojshala (a college) near Dhar. He was a philosopher king and
polymath of medieval India, who ruled the kingdom of Malwa in central India from the early 11th century to 1055 AD.
